posts.cooked: Good evening! We know that we must switch to the new radios this year. However, we would like to keep the old radios for our testing platforms instead of upgrading all the radios that we would need. We are running into the problem that we canâ€™t find the old radio configuration utility. Is there a way that we can still download the old radio configuration utility? Thanks in advance!

posts.name: Carl Hauser
posts.cooked: Thereâ€™s a link to it on this page: Programming your Radio â€” FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

link_counts.title: Programming your Radio â€” FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Tauseef Afraz
posts.cooked: I want to mention that that link is the 2024 version of the WPI documentation

posts.name: Carl Hauser
posts.cooked: Yes. And I believe there is a coming update to the 2025 docs that will incorporate the setup information for the old radios.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: What are you hoping for in the documentation?

posts.name: Tauseef Afraz
posts.cooked:
This

chauser:

setup information for the old radios.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: How does the link already posted not meet your needs for that?

posts.name: Tauseef Afraz
posts.cooked:
That link is the 2024 version of the WPI documentation. This is the 2025/stable version of the documentation: Programming your Radio â€” FIRST Robotics Competition documentation image 1372Ã—682 50.3 KB There is no link to the FRC Radio Configuration for the old radios (nor instructions on how to use it), and I am not sure if the 24.0.1 tool works with the 2025 image/firmwares. If it doesnâ€™t let me know, I will reinstall it first thing in our next practice.

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: Thereâ€™s no new firmware for the old radio, even for areas that will still be using it. The OMAP firmware hasnâ€™t been updated in years anyway.

posts.name: Tauseef Afraz
posts.cooked: Thank you! Iâ€™ll be downloading the 24.0.1 tool.

posts.name: Carl Hauser
posts.cooked: Note that the 2025 documentation now includes a section on configuring the old radio along with a link to an updated configuration tool to handle team numbers > 9999. Please be sure to look at the current documentation.

posts.name: Nathan Zhou
posts.cooked:
Prior to 2025 the official radio used in FRC was an OM5P-AN or OM5P-AC Radio. As of the 2025 season the OpenMesh radio is still being used in Taiwan and China. OpenMesh OM5P-AN or OM5P-AC Radio Eit...

Yes.

And for teams competing in Mainland China and Taiwan old radio is still used.
